decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing powerful multicolored cards that synergize well with each other to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By using cards such as Leyline of the Guildpact and Tribal Flames, along with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, the deck aims to deliver fast damage and control the board. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds additional flexibility and consistency to the deck's strategy. With a mix of burn spells, creatures, and enchantments, this deck aims to establish dominance early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spell cards from the graveyard, creating a loop that can eventually lead to a game-winning combo. The deck includes various cheap artifacts and graveyard recursion tools to enable this strategy, with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Malevolent Rumble providing additional card advantage and disruption options. The goal is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana with cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion, while using Ral, Monsoon Mage to draw cards and control the board. Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse help dig for combo pieces like Past in Flames. Wrenn's Resolve protects your combo pieces and Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional utility. The deck also includes Wish to search for key cards and Valakut Awakening to reshuffle your hand. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a storm of spells.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Dragon's Rage Channeler while also controlling the board with cards like Unholy Heat and Counterspell. Murktide Regent provides a powerful late-game threat, while Lightning Bolt offers additional removal. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain control throughout the game, utilizing efficient spells and countermagic. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells, with cantrips like Expressive Iteration and Preordain providing card selection. Mishra's Bauble offers additional card advantage, making the deck versatile and adaptable in various matchups.
